summary: Internet Computer (Motoko + React/Vite) app to deliver a Class 9 History MCQ test for the chapter "Socialism in Europe and the Russian Revolution" with topic-focused questions, easy-to-hard difficulty progression, and scoring out of 50.

existing_features.title: Project scaffold: IC canisters + React/Vite frontend
existing_features.description: Repository initialized with build scripts/templates, Dockerfile, deploy tooling, canister YAMLs, and a React/Vite frontend wired for Internet Computer deployment.

existing_features.title: Motoko backend canister with generated bindings
existing_features.description: Motoko backend (main.mo) with corresponding Candid/TypeScript declaration artifacts (backend.did.* and backend.d.ts) and frontend actor wiring (backend.ts/useActor).

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication integration (frontend hooks)
existing_features.description: Frontend includes hooks/utilities to authenticate via Internet Identity and manage identity/agent state (useInternetIdentity).

existing_features.title: History Quiz frontend (quiz state + query hooks + UI asset)
existing_features.description: Frontend implements a History Quiz experience with quiz-specific hooks (useQuiz), query/state utilities (useQueries), storage client, and a generated banner asset.

existing_features.title: shadcn/ui component set included via build template
existing_features.description: Large set of shadcn/ui components and related tooling/config included under build-template for reuse (buttons, dialogs, forms, navigation, etc.).

new_feature_requests.summary: MCQ test for Class 9 History chapter "Socialism in Europe and the Russian Revolution" (topics include WWI & Russian Empire, February Revolution & Petrograd, After February) with easy-to-hard questions and final score out of 50
Provide a 25-question set for the MCQ test (question bank/content generation)

Update the backend MCQ question bank to include exactly 25 MCQs for the Class 9 History chapter “Socialism in Europe and the Russian Revolution”, covering the existing topics (#russianEmpire, #februaryRevolution, #afterFebruary) with a clear easy → medium → hard progression.

Ensure the questions delivered to the frontend are ordered from easy to hard (difficulty first, then deterministic tie-break such as question text), so the quiz consistently progresses easy → medium → hard.

Maintain the final score semantics of “out of 50” when the quiz has 25 questions by updating backend scoring logic so the maximum achievable score is exactly 50 for a perfect attempt on all 25 questions.

architectural_notes: Frontend uses React + Vite with Tailwind and shadcn/ui components.
Authentication is handled via Internet Identity through a dedicated hook (useInternetIdentity).
Frontend-backend communication uses generated Candid TypeScript bindings and an actor hook (useActor).
Build-template includes image tooling scripts (resize/prune) and reusable canister/frontend templates.
projectName: Expand History Quiz to a 25-question set
